entries.title: Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar was sprayed with an unknown substance by an unidentified man at a town hall in Minneapolis on Tuesday, according to a statement from her office
Weeks after a U.S. military raid ended the rule of Nicolás Maduro, Venezuelans are living through a whiplash transition that feels less like a democratic dawn and more like an economic takeover
White House border czar Tom Homan arrived in Minneapolis with demands, in particular an agreement from Minnesota officials to turn over more immigrants from their prisons and jails
President Trump defended Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem amid criticism of her and frustration within the White House over how she responded to last weekend’s fatal shooting in Minnesota
As a partial government shutdown looms, Democrats want constraints on the Department of Homeland Security’s activities passed into law
Trump made his first visit to a farm-belt state since his administration announced a $12 billion package for struggling American farmers
President Trump’s pivot in Minneapolis came after Republican lawmakers and other allies raised concerns that he was squandering public support for his immigration policy
Less than 48 hours after U.S. agents fatally shot an ICU nurse in Minnesota, Trump launched the most dramatic reshuffle so far of his immigration team. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics Newsletter:
Democrats want changes to the Department of Homeland Security bill after a deadly Minneapolis shooting, but time is running out
Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar of Minnesota, facing potential investigations pushed by President Trump and House Republicans, isn’t shying away from another fight with the White House
What to know about how the federal investigation of Alex Pretti’s death differs from past cases
Elon Musk is opening his wallet and reigniting his political apparatus for the 2026 midterm elections, signaling a return to the political arena
There are so many plots and subplots in President Trump’s sudden urgency to take control of Greenland. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics newsletter:
Is Trump losing Joe Rogan?
It’s President Trump’s economy now, and voters are increasingly unhappy with how he’s handling it
Mary Peltola will challenge GOP incumbent Sen. Dan Sullivan in Alaska. She served as the first woman to represent Alaska in the House and the first Alaska Native in Congress
The Army will gain access to Salesforce’s technology under a $5.6 billion contract, as the military tries to speed up outdated practices
The Pentagon struck a conciliatory tone toward Beijing in its new defense strategy, stating that its overarching goal is to establish “strategic stability” in the Indo-Pacific region
The Trump administration forced out two Commerce Department officials charged with protecting the U.S. from Chinese tech threats
The Qatari-donated plane that is being overhauled to become a new Air Force One jet is on track to be delivered to President Trump this summer, according to the Air Force
President Trump rules out using force to take control of Greenland and calls off promised tariffs on European nations
